content.rendered:
Literally meaning home of the snow, Himachal Pradesh is the crown jewel destination of India. The entire state is spread across the lush green valleys which are dotted with numerous picturesque tourist spots and iconic heritage sites. Ever since the Vedic age to the British Raj and the present day, Himachal has always attracted a number of peace seekers, adventure lovers, nature enthusiasts, and people wanting to get away from the scorching heat of the plains. Apart from being known for its breathtaking landscapes, Himachal Pradesh is also one of the prime centers of spiritual as well as adventure sports activities. It is the best place to explore for solo travelers, honeymooners as well as family with kids vacationers.

Himachal tour packages offered by us are created keeping in mind the best interest of all our potential clients. You can choose from our varied packages from Himachal Pradesh with Delhi Darshan, thrilling Shimla Manali, scenic Himachal tour package, and incredible Himachal Tour Package for Couple to exotic Himachal Holiday Packages and Himachal with Vaishno Devi Darshan tour package. Take a trip into the land of mystical wonders and unending adventures. From enchantingly holy sites like Hidimba Devi, Bijli Mahadev, Manikaran Sahib to taking a fun ride on the UNESCO world heritage railway line of Shimla toy train journey Himachal Pradesh embraces every traveler with open arms and has something for every visitor here. At Namaste India trip we understand all your requirement which will make your trip to this charming hilly state not only successful but also memorable which will keep you coming back for more.

FAQs for Himachal Tour Packages

Q. What Is Himachal Pradesh Famous For?

A. This gorgeous state is immensely famous for its magnificent Himalayan landscapes and several outdoor activities including Rock Climbing, Rafting, Paragliding, Mountain Biking, Trekking, Rafting, Mountain Biking, and many other exciting activities.

Q. How Much Does It Cost To Visit Himachal Pradesh?

A. Those who are planning to visit Himachal shall plan their budget according to their theme of holiday, the accommodation you select, and many other factors. It costs almost 13000 per person for a weeklong vacation in Himachal.

Q. What Can I Buy In Himachal Pradesh?

A. Himachal Pradesh is one of the most preferred places of almost every traveler especially for honeymoon couples and adventure seekers but if you are a shopaholic personality and visiting this Himalayan city then you can buy Himachali hats, handmade items, local handicrafts, woolen items, traditional jewelry and many other items.

Q. How Can I Go To Himachal Pradesh From Delhi?

A. The fastest and the most convenient way to reach Himachal from Delhi is by airways but if you are looking for a cheaper trip and also want to witness the incredible scenic vistas falling en-route then you must travel by bus. Indian Railway has not made much progress in the city as the state has a difficult and challenging terrain yet there is a very few option than you can look for if you want to travel by train.

Q.What Is The Famous Food Of Himachal Pradesh?

A. Dhaam is the most popular dish and a traditional dish prepared in Himachal Pradesh which is served as Prasad at the temples and if you are a hard core non-vegetarian dish lover then Chha Gosht is a must try delicacy for you in this beautiful state. Khatte Chane is another famous food here that you must binge on.

Q. Who Is The King Of Himachal Pradesh?

A. Shankar Verma, the ruler of Kashmir extended his rule over Himachal Pradesh in 883 AD and then in 1009 AD, Mahmud Ghazni also invaded in the region.

Q. How To Reach Kashmir From Delhi?

A. You can cover this 690 km long distance by both railways and airways depending upon your budget of travel. Delhi is nicely connected with Jammu by train and then from Jammu you can opt for a taxi or bus to cover the rest of the journey. IRCTC Kashmir package makes your journey easier and more convenient.

Q. What Should I Pack For Himachal Pradesh?

A. Warm Clothes, Sunscreen lotion, camera and batteries, power bank, hats, appropriate shoes, medication, etc. are few of the must pack things in your baggage.
